title: Need testers for AOSP O Preview 2 [Android O for hammerhead]

threads.text: Should I say anything or this is just for fun? You can't get android o until google release the code. And msm8974 devices won't run Android O sadly due to new kernel changes, would require lots of backports so be happy with nougat

replies.text: maybe he use some code from caf
No he's not xD and that doesn't make any difference

What if I give you a working build in a week?  Will you be willing to give up your RD title to me if I do give you a working build 🌚 Code is looooong released since april. You just ain't looking in the right places. And msm8974 already boots on bacon for me. Why not hammerhead? Backports? Ofcourse hwbinder has to be backported for 32 bit devices like us in the kernel. I can do that.

Anyone wants to help testing, telegram or quote me. Anyone wants to discourage me, gtfo cry and watch me succeed.

Nope my friend you won't get android o current features. you only getting merged commits from master branch xD If we all have learned among this years is that you need to wait for the google to release the source code from official android o for start working on that. they don't release the source of preview builds... And about the backports, you'll need some netd backports in the kernel and will be a headache ... Good luck either way
Meh even after you get the source' you want you'll have to rework the kernel. Preview sources are released just for that work. No body is looking for features on previews except for you.
So don't call it android o preview which is not xD it's just nougat with master branch commits
You booted android o on bacon? Can you port for cancro (mi3) ?. Use msm8974 too
My close friend did. I've seen it running. If I can get a cancro, sure.

threads.text: Should I say anything or this is just for fun? You can't get android o until google release the code. And msm8974 devices won't run Android O sadly due to new kernel changes, would require lots of backports so be happy with nougat

title: [Review] "Skinnova" skin for Nexus5 made by Gadgetshieldz "Pictures uploaded"

threads.text: Thanks U solved my purpose....

replies.text: What kinda purpose bro?? It's out of my curiosity.

threads.text:
Earlier I have ordered from Slickwraps , which never arrived to me in 6 months time. Then I got one from Ebay at @ Rate of Rs.2499 and applied it to my white nexus. Then  I again ordered one from Dbrand for my Black nexus. Which also took me 1.5 Month to arrive in India.

Now I have bought a Red Nexus 5 again to which I was finding skins within ebay and other Indian websites, where they were unavailable.

But your post gave me the exact place to buy one. I spent 4-5 days trying to find one skin within India. Your OP is the exact situation I was going through for the last one week.

Thanks a Ton.

---------- Post added at 02:55 AM ---------- Previous post was at 02:43 AM ----------





Both my nexus s,,and then New Red Nexus...

replies.text: Ohh okay and it is okay bro.

threads.text:
Fantastic skin . I have applied it on my nexus 5 device n its perfect ! Highly recommended to all ! 
For buying visit - gadgetshieldz.in

replies.text: That's very good. Enjoy

threads.text:
Bought sandstone red skin from Gadget shieldz( https://www.gadgetshieldz.in )for my Nexus 5 & I'm lovin' it! Love the color, love the texture & most of all love to hold the phone as gives an extra grip while holding. Believe me that's an extra plus point as the phone slips from my hands whenever they get dry in AC. There were sticker for front and sides, I didn't use them though.
Pros: 1) Nicely design with cut out for Nexus logo on back.
2) Nice texture and gives a good feel
3) Adhesive is very strong and not messy so keep the skin at place.
4) Package  comes with detail instructions and front skin guard along with back and side skins.

Cons: 1) Size is little bit smaller though it's not visible normally.
2) Adhesive is very strong so faulty application will give hard time for re-positioning.

Suggestion for the designers : Please put two adhesive protectors behind meeting at the middle so that they can be pulled from both sides making proper positioning easier.
Overall I love it!

replies.text: that's a great looking skin you got there. you can pair it with bumper case.

threads.text: A question guys, I'm planning to buy this, but what will happen if it comes in contact of water ? As my phone is water resistant but I'm not too sure about the Skinnova skin

replies.text: how the **** nexus 5 is water resistant??

Love the color, love the texture & most of all love to hold the phone as gives an extra grip while holding. Believe me that's an extra plus point as the phone slips from my hands whenever they get dry in AC. There were sticker for front and sides, I didn't use them though.
Pros: 1) Nicely design with cut out for Nexus logo on back.
2) Nice texture and gives a good feel
3) Adhesive is very strong and not messy so keep the skin at place.
4) Package  comes with detail instructions and front skin guard along with back and side skins.

Cons: 1) Size is little bit smaller though it's not visible normally.
2) Adhesive is very strong so faulty application will give hard time for re-positioning.

title: Power saving mode on lollipop lags more than on preview

threads.text:
I think it's normal. 
If you want no lag when using Power Saving Mode, use faux kernel. 
Because it has turbo boost, and works good with Power Saving with no lag.

Yeah, I noticed lag too when battery saver was on too. I did not even have but maybe 3 apps open in recent apps. It definitely was not just a little lag either, it was pretty bad.  I definitely would not say that is 'normal' considering when you put an M8 or any other device in battery saving mode, it lags absolutely nothing like that.  I wonder if it is because they have the CPU too under clocked for battery saving more. Regardless of the cause that is definitely something Google needs to work out.

replies.text: You can try what I suggest above. On Lollipop, the one I know is stock kernel is not the best anymore.

threads.text:
I personally use Hybrid Kernel. For the moment, I see it as the most updated kernel simply because all of the drivers are updated, and there's some CAF code but it works on AOSP wonderfully.

Keep in mind, there are plenty of other good kernels and I have tested them all. This is what works best for ME.
I noticed the  same issue with my S4 5.0.1. Turning on power save mode causes lag especially when scrolling anda tapping. I used Root Booster in Battery mode also if it makes the lag worse.

title: Google didn't release android N developer preview for Nexus 5 :(

threads.text: Wish we can get the final build later. 😢
Time to upgrade the Nexus 5. Wait, damn there is no other Nexus phone like the Nexus 5 in its time.

There's hope.

N4 didn't get L preview, but was updated to Lollipop (final).

Same for N7 2013 and Marshmallow.

this picture taken from android authority

Nexus 5 is visible to nearby .........................



http://www.androidauthority.com/andr...atures-673002/

To be fair, the Nexus 5 is an aged (albeit extremely well) device which Google will probably drop support for either this year or the next.

I had a Nexus 4 last year and I felt the same way - we didn't get the L or M previews.

Last year, an attempt was made to port the M preview to the Nexus 4, but due to a lack of release on similar architecture (like the Nexus 7 2013, whose proprietary bits were used to port L to the Nexus 4), no preview was ever released.

What I mean to say with this is that it will be difficult for an N preview to be made on the Nexus 5 - and if it is done, then the developers need to be lauded highly!

I don't want a preview at all.

The final build, on the other hand...
Preview is not my type but google will hurt many if there's no official final android N for N5. Frankly speaking N5 is still fast and smooth for daily use.

Seems that's no time to nexus 5 dead...


https://android.googlesource.com/dev...id-n-preview-1

replies.text: That's from 3 weeks ago, does this still mean something?
